Event.name: Limiting
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits a <fen>Range_of_options</fen> to having a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen>. The <fen>Characteristic</fen> may be that only certain types of the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> may be acceptable, or (in the case of a plural or mass <fen>Range_of_options</fen>) that only certain cardinalities or quanties are acceptable. Alternatively, the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited may be mentioned.
<ex><fex name="cau">His choices in life</fex> have <t>limited</t> <fex name="ran">his opportunities</fex> <fex name="deg">severely</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ran">Treatment</fex> was <t>limited</t> <fex name="cha">to one pill per day</fex>. <fex name="age">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
<ex><fex name="age">The military</fex> <t>limited</t> building access to key personnel.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.
<ex><fex name="cau">Ongoing rains</fex> have <t>limited</t> drivers to a small number of roads.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Range_of_options
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Range_of_options</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
<ex>The military <t>limited</t> <fex name="ran">building access</fex> to key personnel.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> has been limited.
<ex>Our choices have now been <fex name="deg">severely</fex> <t>limited</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Characteristic
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Characteristic</fen> indicates the subtypes or situations to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
<ex>The military <t>limited</t> access <fex name="cha">to key personnel only</fex>.</ex>
<ex>You should <t>limit</t> your meals <fex name="cha">to three per day at most</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the limiting takes place.
<ex>Banks are <fex name="tim">currently</fex> <t>limiting</t> customers to two cash transactions per day.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time over which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
<ex>If you <t>limit</t> your caloric intake <fex name="dur">for too long</fex>, it could damage your health.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> of <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the Agent or Cause that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which the Agent or Cause limits the Range_of_options. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: limit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: place constraints on choices or possibilities of something.
